factsheet.heading: HISTORIC BROMLEY TOWN EXHIBITION
paragraphs: An Exhibition celebrating the historic character and heritage of Bromley from its origins as a Kentish market town through the Victorian Golden Age to the present time with many buildings in the Arts and Crafts style that can be seen today.

Visitors will learn about the fascinating history of Bromley town and of the architecture and stories behind the buildings that can still be seen and appreciated today.   The town is a treasure trove of Arts and Crafts architecture; also Dutch and French Influence, Queen Anne and Neo Georgian - it's all  there!  Quotes from previous residents HG Wells,  David Bowie and Hanif Kureishi are included

images.title: An Exhibition celebrating the historic character and heritage of Bromley town.
Bromley Palace - 1,000 year link with the Bishops of Rochester
Bromley & Sheppards Colleges - Wren style architecture dating from 1666
Many wonderful Victorian photos feature in the Exhibition

location.address: Lower Mall, The Glades shopping centre

name: Historic Bromley Town Exhibition
